Method Detail

populateDataByIndexes

public void populateDataByIndexes(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: Rows
Given a ResultSet, loop through each row in the ResultSet and create an appropriate Row object that represents a ResultSet row. The assumption is that this method retrieves the columns in each ResultSet row in the order the column was defined in the table (by a 1-based numeric index).
Overrides:
populateDataByIndexes in class AbstractRows

populateDataByNames

public void populateDataByNames(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: Rows
Given a ResultSet, loop through each row in the ResultSet and create an appropriate Row object that represents a ResultSet row. The ordering of columns is not important because each Row that will be created will search for its columns in the ResultSet by name.
Overrides:
populateDataByNames in class AbstractRows

populateDataByNames

public void populateDataByNames(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
                         throws java.text.ParseException,
                                org.w3c.dom.DOMException
Description copied from interface: Rows
Given an XML element that contains row/column data, extract each row and create an appropriate Row instance. The main element must follow this DTD (the element parameter to the method call is assumed to be the "data" element):
Overrides:
